title: How to Cook Orange Roughy

steps.headline: Purchase the orange roughy.
steps.description: Orange roughy is growing in popularity, and now can be found at most grocery stores or fish markets. When choosing orange roughy, look for a fish that has moist skin, clear eyes, and does not present a fishy odor. While orange roughy is most commonly sold in fillets, some locations may still sell the whole fish. If this is a problem, ask the fishmonger to clean the fish for you before you purchase it. Most grocery store or fish market experts will be willing to do this free of charge.

steps.headline: Season the fish.
steps.description: Orange roughy, which is to be grilled, should be seasoned with a small amount of salt and pepper on both sides before starting the cooking process. Drizzling the fish with a small amount of freshly squeezed lemon juice is also a good choice.

steps.headline: Prepare the grill.
steps.description: A grill that is being used to cook orange roughy should be quite hot. Start the grill at least 20 minutes before applying the fish for best cooking results.

steps.headline: Place the fish in the grilling basket.
steps.description: Orange roughy has a relatively delicate texture. Because of this, grilling can be quite hard on the fish physically. To prevent tearing or damaging the flesh of the fish, consider placing it in a grilling basket. These are small "cages" which can be placed directly on top of a grill, and are effective at cooking a variety of foods which otherwise might not fare well on a grill.

steps.headline: Cook the fish.
steps.description: In general, 4 minutes per side on the grill for the orange roughy is plenty of time to ensure complete cooking.

steps.headline: Season the fish.
steps.description: Like during grilling, orange roughy which is to be broiled must also be seasoned before cooking. In this method, consider sprinkling the fish with a small amount of Cajun seasoning to enhance the cooking process.

steps.headline: Prepare the equipment.
steps.description: To broil orange roughy, you will first need to set the oven to broil. In addition, spraying a large baking sheet or broiling pan with cooking spray is necessary to prevent the delicate flesh of the fish from sticking to the pan during cooking.

steps.headline: Place the fish in the oven.
steps.description: Place the prepared fish on the greased baking sheet or broiling pan, and place in the oven. Ideally, the fish should be about 3 inches (7.6 cm) away from the heat source for best results.

steps.headline: Cook the fish.
steps.description: Orange roughy should be broiled for approximately 6 minutes. Test with a fork to ensure the fish is tender before removing from the heat.

steps.headline: Season the fish.
steps.description: A light seasoning of lemon, salt, and pepper is ideal while microwaving orange roughy.

steps.headline: Cook the orange roughy.
steps.description: Place the fish in a microwave-safe bowl, and place in the microwave. Cook with general heat for approximately 4 minutes, and check for doneness. If the fish does not flake easily with a fork, continue cooking for 30 second intervals until the fish appears to be completely cooked.
